Author: mole99
Content:
- project template: https://github.com/wafer-space/gf180mcu-project-template/tree/antenna-calculations
- PDK: https://github.com/wafer-space/gf180mcu/tree/antenna-calculations

Due to the patch KLayout needs to recompile when invoking the Nix shell.

Author: mole99
Content: @Tholin can you verify that this resolves the false positives?

Author: 246tnt
Content: FWIW, I ran the chip_top that @Tholin posted yesterday through locally patched KLayout / PDK and it's not reporting any violations.

Author: mole99
Content:
No violations at all? That's great!
Well, hopefully we *do* get violations if they are above the limit üòÑ

Author: mole99
Content: Could you perhaps post your patch in the KLayout issue as a quick starting point for Matthias?

Author: 246tnt
Content:
Yeah, knowing if there are actual violations or not is harder üòÖ 
Although TBH, given the massive multiplier of 15, it'd be quite challenging to get a violation when any diode is involved. On 3v3 designs, that'd be more likely so maybe Tim will see some in his designs.

Author: 246tnt
Content: How is the filler update doing ?  It's the last expected fix right ?

Author: mole99
Content:
It's going well: https://github.com/wafer-space/gf180mcu/commits/filler-generation/
The last commit should fix all remaining DPF.1 violations.
Then, we'll see if we can still meet the density limits for all designs...

Author: mole99
Content: Another issue is that some designs take multiple hours for the KLayout antenna check. I think there's something going wrong. I checked the connectivity setup for potential shorts, but I don't see how this can happen for some designs but not for others.

Author: egorxe
Content: @Leo Moser (mole99) I'll experiment with disabling Antenna fixing stages in LibreLane for my design and see if I'll get matching antenna violations in KLayout.

Author: rebelmike
Content: I was wondering how long this might take - admittedly this is on my laptop but `Executing rule ANT.16_i_ANT.2` has taken over an hour when all of the flow up to that point took ~20 mins

Author: rebelmike
Content: (this is on a quarter slot design)

Author: egorxe
Content: Antenna runtime depends very much on the ammount of routing, especially on upper layers. So obviously high density designs will take several times longer to verify.
